Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Subseries VII.C: Legal Documents and Legislation
Subseries VII.C: Legal Documents and Legislation

This subseries holds legal documents concerning several federal laws enacted during the 1940s and 1950s, such as the McCarran Act and the Smith Act, and New York State's Feinberg Law, under which CPUSA members were prosecuted. It also holds files originating from the CPUSA regarding protest and activism in reaction to these laws. Records and reports from US congressional committees, like the House Committee on Un-American Activities (generally known as the House Un-American Activities Committee or HUAC), can also be found here. There are also two scrapbooks on various communist trials.
